intro: Carelia houstoniana, commonly known as the Houstonia or Houston's carelia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has opposite, simple leaves and produces small, red berries that contain the seeds. Carelia houstoniana is often found in the understory of forests and thrives in partial to full shade.
